title: I don't want to give a bad rating if I misunderstood
comment: Is this only for phones? I installed on my tablet and can't figure out how any of it works. I have the wikidpad for Windows and love using it. If it's only for phones then i'll retract my review but if it does work for tablets and someone can explain to me how to get started loading a word list I would appreciate it.

title: Great
comment: It's awesome to be able to view and browse my notes on my device. Keep up the good work!

title: WikiAndPad ROCKS!
comment: Please, please, pretty please continue to develop! I haven't found anything that comes even close to the pc version. I really need this app to have more functions.

title: Great app.
comment: Can you rebuild for KitKat? Used it on different devices.  And it crashes when opening my existing wiki.   Thanks

title: Good
comment: This app works good. Two areas for improvement that are important to me. Wiki words created here don't automatically add themselves into my desktop version when I sync with Dropbox, and there is no night theme. Other than those two things, this app is great for editing your wiki and makes it easy to get down your ideas on the go.

title: Great to see this is going
comment: I hope I can contribute to this!

title: Awesome!
comment: Being fanatic wikidpad user I waited for android version

title: Great start
comment: Looking forward to setting how this app develops. Big fan of the desktop version.

title: Thanks
comment: I use Wikidpad in my home system to create a working database and needed a mobile app just to access and view.  A nice tweak would be the option to view and search a mobile Wiki as a Read-Only.

title: Love this to death
comment: I heard about this program on the Writing Excuses podcast.  This app is the best thing ever, especially when paired with dropbox.  It's such a great resource.

title: Excellent work-in-progress
comment: I'm writing a book on mythology and this wiki is an excellent resource for keeping everything straight!
